skillTree.localised_description: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

skillTree.localised_description: A Knightly formation, in the Lady's name, to smash through battle lines; to defeat evil in the field.
From the verdant depths, the Lady rises to protect the faithful.
The Lady's blessing is a wondrous gift freely graced upon all Bretonnian subjects, should they but kneel and utter their devotion.

effects.description: Passive ability: "The Blessing of the Lady"

skillTree.localised_description: Led by noble example, peasants fight longer and harder lest their Lord be dishonoured.
Like the lion, this one is the biggest and the bravest of his kind... with the sharpest teeth.
Thorough drilling increases the peasants' chances of withstanding the horrors of battle.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Flames shall cleanse the corrupt and destroy what cannot be healed.

The Knights have crusaded extensively against the enemies of all right thinking folk and gained a considerable reputation from their enemies. Amongst the Goblins they became renowned as 'The Frothers', whilst the Arabyans dubbed Sir John 'The Foaming One'.
"I am but a simple man. To serve this most holy quest is reward enough for me."

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +15 for Battle Pilgrim, Grail Reliquae and all Knight units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Battle Pilgrim, Grail Reliquae and all Knight units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Battle Pilgrim, Grail Reliquae and all Knight units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned from their past experiences with the undead and arabyans, the knights shall not have a rest until the entire Nehekhara has been cleansed.
Holy Monasteries must be protected in these dangerous deserts, preferably with nearly impregnable fortresses.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for all units when defending
	(armies in local province)

Melee attack: +6 for all units when defending
	(armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Sir John was chosen as the grand master of the knights after his predecessor was brutally murdered by the heathens. From that day forward he has sworn to lead his loyal brothers and sisters to glory or die trying, there is no alternative.
The Knights have crusaded extensively against the enemies of all right thinking folk and as such have gained a considerable reputation from their enemies.

effects.description: Melee attack: +8 when fighting against Tomb Kings, Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Arabyan factions

skillTree.localised_description: "The Lady calls me hence. I must answer herâ€¦"

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Tomb Kings, Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Arabyan factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Tomb Kings, Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Arabyan factions

skillTree.localised_description: Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even stupid peasants can learn to stand fast and brace against the charge.

skillTree.localised_description: When the alternative probably involves being killed by their own side, the smallfolk tend to rise to the occasion...

skillTree.localised_description: Many Bretonnian veterans speak of a soothing presence felt on occasion in the heat of battle, helping them to find their mark and keep their cool.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"Let your name be on the lips of every man and woman; your great deeds go before you!"
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The Lord is entitled to collect tithes from tenants in return for continued protection.
"You will fight for ze Lady or you'll swim back to Bordeleaux! For ze Lady!"
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: "The land from here to the sea is yours, if you enforce the king's will."
"We'll take them from under the ground, don't you worry - it'll be done soon."

skillTree.localised_description: This being must be touched by Tzeentch, seeing things before they happen.

skillTree.localised_description: Lords must not be concerned with the collecting of taxes; there are others whose lot it is to feel the people's scorn.

factionEffects.localised_description: Years ago the Knights of Origo were driven back from their Monastery in Fyrus by Arabyan pirates. The Knights lost almost all that they hold dear - even their Grand Master was slain in combat. Luckily some of the knights survived that fight and with their newly chosen Grand Master, Sir John Tyreweld began their decade long crusade against all non-believers. Now the Grand Master has finally decided to reconquer their once glorious monastery and built it even stronger than it used to be. After that's done Sir John and his knights should consider joining the other crusaders in their fight or is it time to find other places to conquer and cleanse?

effects.description: Passive ability: "Frenzy" for Knight Lords, embedded Paladin Heroes and all Knights units

Leadership is higher than 50% of base

Raiding stance does not count as dishonourable act

items.colour_text: This sword was carried by Grand Master Sir Gaspard Mercier, the first Grand Master of Knights of Origo. It was passed down to Sir John when he was selected as new Grand Master following the events that destroyed the Monastery of Saint Origo in Fyrus.
